title: Ordering at a Restaurant
description: Learn essential phrases for ordering food and drinks at Portuguese restaurants, including how to ask for the menu, make requests, and pay the bill.
objectives: Ask for and pay the bill

vocabulary.example: Pode trazer a ementa, por favor?

vocabulary.notes: How to ask for the check

vocabulary.example: Uma garrafa de água, por favor.

grammar.title: Using 'Queria' vs 'Quero'
grammar.content: 'Queria' (I would like) is more polite than 'Quero' (I want). Always use 'Queria' when ordering in restaurants to be courteous.
examples: Polite: Queria uma sopa, por favor.

grammar.title: Asking Questions
grammar.content: To ask what something is or if they have something, use 'O que é...?' (What is...?) or 'Tem...?' (Do you have...?).
examples: O que é bacalhau? (What is bacalhau?)
Tem vinho da casa? (Do you have house wine?)

exercises.question: How do you politely ask for the menu?
exercises.explanation: 'A ementa, por favor' is the polite way to ask for the menu.

exercises.question: How do you say 'I would like a coffee' in Portuguese?
exercises.explanation: 'Queria um café' means 'I would like a coffee' - the polite way to order.

exercises.question: How do you ask for the bill?
exercises.explanation: 'A conta, por favor' means 'The bill, please'.

exercises.question: Complete: ____ mim, uma sopa. (For me, a soup)
exercises.explanation: 'Para mim' means 'for me' and is commonly used when ordering.

exercises.question: What do you say to someone before they start eating?
exercises.explanation: 'Bom apetite' means 'Enjoy your meal' and is said before eating.

culturalNotes.title: Couvert (Cover Charge)
culturalNotes.content: In Portuguese restaurants, bread, olives, and spreads are often brought to your table automatically. This is called 'couvert' and you'll be charged for it. You can refuse it if you don't want it.

culturalNotes.title: Service and Tipping
culturalNotes.content: Service charge is usually included in Portuguese restaurants. Tipping is not obligatory but rounding up or leaving 5-10% for good service is appreciated.

culturalNotes.title: Meal Times
culturalNotes.content: Lunch is typically served from 12:30-2:30 PM, and dinner from 7:30-10:00 PM. Many restaurants close between lunch and dinner service.
